It is one of four CDAs at the Centre<br>for Studies of Home on the research programme \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdHome and religion: space,<br>practice and community in London from the seventeenth century to the<br>present,\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd all of which will start on 1 October 2015. [...] Steenbergh, K. 2015-03-05T12:25:25+00:00 2015-03-05T12:25:25+00:00 CFP Compassion in Early Modern Culture (1550-1700) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORYOFEMOTIONS;1ab2e5e4.1503 Call for papers: Compassion in Early Modern Culture (1550-1700)<br><br>VU University Amsterdam, The Netherlands, 18-19 September 2015<br><br>This two-day international conference aims to bring together literary scholars, art historians, musicologists, and cultural historians to explore thinking about the experience as well as the social and political impact of compassion in early modern European culture. It seeks to combine two current approaches to the early modern passions: historical phenomenology on the one hand and the analysis of the role of compassion in the public sphere on the other. Sir Philip Sidney famously claimed political impact for the experience of compassion when [...] Macfarlane, Ross 2015-02-26T18:34:20+00:00 2015-02-26T18:34:20+00:00 Wellcome Trust Research Bursaries https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORYOFEMOTIONS;5adb8f0.1502 Dear colleagues,<br>With apologies for cross-posting.<br>I just wanted to bring to the attention of this list the new Wellcome Trust Research Bursaries scheme.<br>This scheme is for small and medium-scale research projects based on library or archive collections supported by the Wellcome Trust. Projects must focus either on Wellcome Library holdings (http://wellcomelibrary.org/collections/) or on any collection supported by a previous Research Resources grant (http://www.wellcome.ac.uk/Funding/Medical-humanities/Funding-schemes/Research-resources-awards/Projects-funded/index.htm), but they need not be historically grounded.<br>These awards can support experienced researchers based in the UK and the Republic of Ireland. Thiery, PhD<br>Associate Professor of Medieval History<br>Chair, Department of History<br>Iona College<br>dthiery@iona.edu<mailto:dthiery@iona.edu><br><br>CALL FOR PAPERS<br>WHY THE HUMANITIES:<br>Answers from the Cognitive and Neurosciences [...] Macfarlane, Ross 2015-02-12T14:36:07+00:00 2015-02-12T14:36:07+00:00 History of Pre-Modern Medicine seminar - 17th February, 'Approaching Medieval Disfigurement: a Medical Problem?' https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORYOFEMOTIONS;5ce3be1e.1502 Dear colleagues,<br><br>With apologies for any cross-posting, but I thoughts the next seminar in the History of Pre-Modern series would be of interest to HISTORYOFEMOTIONS subscribers.<br><br>The seminar is on Tuesday 17th February with Dr Patricia Skinner (University of Winchester)<br><br>Details:<br><br>Approaching Medieval Disfigurement: a Medical Problem?<br><br>This paper reviews the results of the Wellcome Trust-funded project 'Losing Face? Living with Disfigurement in the Early Middle Ages'. After examining the types of evidence for disfigured people in Europe from c.800-1100CE, it then explores why disfigurement has been a relatively neglected subject for historical enquiry. I will argue that it has [...] justo hernandez 2015-01-31T11:37:11+00:00 2015-01-31T11:37:11+00:00 XXVIII SYMPOSIUM https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORYOFEMOTIONS;17ca9034.1501 Dear collaegues,<br>I am the chairman of the XXVIII SYMPOSIUM OF THE SPANISH SOCIETY OF HISTORY OF PSYCHOLOGY<br>symposiumsehp2015.es/en/<br><br>Best wishes<br>Justo Hern\ufffd\ufffdndez<br><br>The HISTORY OF EMOTIONS email list is run by the Queen Mary Centre for the History of the Emotions<br>http://www.qmul.ac.uk/emotions<br><br>The Centre also hosts the History of Emotions Blog<br>http://emotionsblog.history.qmul.ac.uk/<br><br>To modify your subscription to this list, or to unsubscribe, go to:<br>http://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/historyofemotions Dr. David Bolt 2015-01-30T10:18:45+00:00 2015-01-30T10:18:45+00:00 Disability and Disciplines conference: final reminder for proposals https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORYOFEMOTIONS;9484fd7d.1501 Disability and Disciplines:<br>The International Conference on Educational, Cultural, and Disability Studies<br><br>1-2 July, 2015<br><br>Centre for Culture and Disability Studies, Faculty of Education, Liverpool Hope University<br><br>Keynote Speakers:<br>Julie Allan (University of Birmingham, UK)<br>Peter Beresford (Brunel University London, UK)<br>David Mitchell (George Washington University, USA)<br>Sharon Snyder (George Washington University, USA)<br><br>When we think of disability in Higher Education we are likely to think in terms of access, Learning Support Plans, and so on. These and other such things are of great importance but only represent part of the approach proposed at the biennial CCDS conference. The trouble is that disabled dance artists are absent from the mainstream of the discipline, a possible cause being the lack of leadership among disabled artists. The question is how empowering is artistic leadership in the context of dance and [...] Douglas Cairns 2015-01-27T15:28:02+00:00 2015-01-27T15:28:02+00:00 emotions e-seminar https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORYOFEMOTIONS;a738e032.1501 Dear colleagues,<br><br>Members of this list may be interested in an online lecture/seminar on emotion at http://www.hdc.ed.ac.uk/seminars/emotions-body-and-world.<br><br>This is a presentation by Professor Giovanna Colombetti (Exeter) on ‘Emotions in the Body and the World’. Replies and inquiries to Dr Federico Botana:? f.botana@qmul.ac.uk<br><br>?Tuesday 27 January, 17:15, Arts 2, Room 3.20<br><br>Sarah Dunant<br><br>Bringing the Renaissance to life. 'Historical fiction': Bastard malformed child or perfect genetic mutation?<br><br>Sarah Dunant, historian by training but novelist by profession, has written four acclaimed novels set in Renaissance Italy. (Prof.) 2015-01-16T15:42:14+00:00 2015-01-16T15:42:14+00:00 Passions of War: Cross-Disciplinary Perspectives on Gender, Sexuality and Conflict, 1550-1945 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORYOFEMOTIONS;cb607241.1501 Passions of War:Cross-Disciplinary Perspectives on Gender, Sexuality and Conflict, 1550-1945<br><br>Passions of War is the name of a new international research network, funded by the Arts & Humanities Research Council (AHRC).<br><br>The Network brings together EU and international participants, representing a range of academic disciplines and professional backgrounds, to investigate the influence of war, from the early modern period to the end of the Second World War, on constructions of gender and sexual practices, and how these constructions and practices have, in turn, conditioned the ways in which wars are waged, mediated, felt and understood.
